bug.short_desc: hdf5: is packaging mod under /usr/include/{openmpi,mpich}-x86_64 correct?
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The guidelines https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:MPI require mod to be placed under:
MPI_FORTRAN_MOD_DIR %{_fmoddir}/%{name} MPI stack specific Fortran module directory
When doing a search I see:
$ dnf provides "/usr/include/*-x86_64/*.mod" | grep '\.fc' | sort | uniq hdf5-mpich-devel-1.8.17-1.fc25.x86_64 : HDF5 mpich development files hdf5-mpich-devel-1.8.17-2.fc25.x86_64 : HDF5 mpich development files hdf5-openmpi-devel-1.8.17-1.fc25.x86_64 : HDF5 openmpi development files hdf5-openmpi-devel-1.8.17-2.fc25.x86_64 : HDF5 openmpi development files netcdf-fortran-mpich-devel-4.4.4-1.fc25.x86_64 : NetCDF Fortran mpich netcdf-fortran-openmpi-devel-4.4.4-1.fc25.x86_64 : NetCDF Fortran openmpi
and:
$ dnf provides /usr/lib64/gfortran/modules/*/*.mod | grep '\.fc' | sort | uniq elpa-mpich-devel-2015.11.001-1.fc25.x86_64 : Development files for ELPA (MPICH elpa-openmpi-devel-2015.11.001-1.fc25.x86_64 : Development files for ELPA mpich-devel-3.2-6.fc25.x86_64 : Development files for mpich openmpi-devel-1.10.4-4.fc25.x86_64 : Development files for openmpi
What are the consequences from moving the modules from %{_includedir}/%{name}-%{_arch} to %{_fmoddir}/%{name}? Do all applications which use mod will have to do -I${MPI_FORTRAN_MOD_DIR}?
Note that the solution should cover both Fedora and RHEL.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.

Expected results:
Additional info:
How is this affected by bug #983057 ?
Fixed in hdf5-1.8.18-3.fc26. Yes, packages depending on MPI Fortran modules will need to specify -I${MPI_FORTRAN_MOD_DIR}.
